meanings.definition: Of the darkest color due to the absence of or complete absorption of light.
meanings.sent1: The night sky was black and full of stars.
meanings.sent2: She wore a black dress to the funeral.
meanings.sent3: The black cat blended perfectly with the dark room.
meanings.sent4: His mood was as black as a stormy sky.
meanings.sent5: The black hole seemed to swallow all the light around it.

meanings.definition: A member of a dark-skinned people, especially one of African or Australian Aboriginal ancestry.
meanings.sent1: The black at the party danced gracefully.
meanings.sent2: My friend is proud of her black heritage.
meanings.sent3: The black in the movie stole the show with their talent.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was as black as a raven's wing.
meanings.sent5: The black in the photograph had a warm smile.

meanings.sent1: She accidentally blacked her shoes while gardening.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic blacked his hands while fixing the car.
meanings.sent3: He blacked the wall with paint, but missed a spot.
meanings.sent4: The rain blacked the once clean pavement.
meanings.sent5: The mud blacked the white carpet in an instant.
